text: Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much.
author: Helen Keller

text: I could never stay long enough on the shore; the tang of the untainted, fresh, and free sea air was like a cool, quieting thought.
author: Helen Keller

text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.
author: Helen Keller

text: The best and most beautiful things in this world cannot be seen or even heard, but must be felt with the heart.
author: Helen Keller

text: I do not want the peace which passeth understanding, I want the understanding which bringeth peace.
author: Helen Keller

text: Happiness cannot come from without. It must come from within. It is not what we see and touch or that which others do for us which makes us happy; it is that which we think and feel and do, first for the other fellow and then for ourselves.
author: Helen Keller

text: Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness.
author: Helen Keller

text: True friends never apart maybe in distance but never in heart.
author: Helen Keller

text: Alone we can do so little, together we can do so much.
author: Helen Keller

text: Resolve to keep happy and your joy and you shall form an invincible host against difficulties.
author: Helen Keller

text: Never bend your head. Always hold it high. Look the world right in the eye.
author: Helen Keller

text: I would rather walk with a friend in the dark, than alone in the light.
author: Helen Keller

text: The struggle of life is one of our greatest blessings. It makes us patient, sensitive, and Godlike. It teaches us that although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.
author: Helen Keller

text: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow.
author: Helen Keller

text: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope or confidence.
author: Helen Keller

text: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, vision cleared, ambition inspired, and success achieved.
author: Helen Keller

text: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, ambition inspired, and success achieved.
author: Helen Keller

text: What we have once enjoyed we can never lose. All that we love deeply becomes a part of us.
author: Helen Keller

text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot _be seen or even touched._They must be felt with the heart.
author: Helen Keller

text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched. They must be felt with the heart.
author: Helen Keller

text: A happy life consists not in the absence, but in the mastery of hardships.
author: Helen Keller

text: Keep your face to the sunshine and you will never see the shadow.
author: Helen Keller

text: I am only one; but still I am one. I cannot do everything, but still I can do something; I will not refuse to do something I can do.
author: Helen Keller

text: Life is an exciting business, and most exciting when it is lived for others.
author: Helen Keller

text: College isn't the place to go for ideas.
author: Helen Keller

text: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
author: Helen Keller

text: Your success and happiness lies in you. Resolve to keep happy, and your joy and you shall form an invincible host against difficulties.
author: Helen Keller

text: I long to accomplish a great and noble task, but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.
author: Helen Keller

text: What I'm looking for is not out there, it is in me.
author: Helen Keller

text: As selfishness and complaint pervert the mind, so love with its joy clears and sharpens the vision.
author: Helen Keller

text: Life is either a great adventure or nothing.
author: Helen Keller

text: Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of the overcoming of it.
author: Helen Keller

text: Knowledge is love and light and vision.
author: Helen Keller

text: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.
author: Helen Keller

text: You will find a joy in overcoming obstacles.
author: Helen Keller

text: The welfare of each is bound up in the welfare of all.
author: Helen Keller

text: I do not want the peace that passeth understanding. I want the understanding which bringeth peace.
author: Helen Keller

text: The highest result of education is tolerance.
author: Helen Keller

text: Tolerance is the first principle of community; it is the spirit which conserves the best that all men think.
author: Helen Keller

text: Toleration is the greatest gift of the mind; it requires the same effort of the brain that it takes to balance oneself on a bicycle.
author: Helen Keller

text: Doing your best means never stop trying.
author: Helen Keller

text: One can never consent to creep when one feels an impulse to soar.
author: Helen Keller

text: It is wonderful how much time good people spend fighting the devil. If they would only expend the same amount of energy loving their fellow men, the devil would die in his own tracks of ennui.
author: Helen Keller

text: Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of men as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.
author: Helen Keller

text: What we have once enjoyed deeply we can never lose. All that we love deeply becomes a part of us.
author: Helen Keller

text: It is not possible for civilization to flow backward while there is youth in the world. Youth may be headstrong, but it will advance its allotted length.
author: Helen Keller

text: There is no king who has not had a slave among his ancestors, and no slave who has not had a king among his.
author: Helen Keller

text: All the world is full of suffering. It is also full of overcoming.
author: Helen Keller

text: We may have found a cure for most evils; but it has found no remedy for the worst of them all -- the apathy of human beings.
author: Helen Keller

text: Although the world is full of suffering, it is full also of the overcoming of it.
author: Helen Keller

text: Everything has its wonders, even darkness and silence, and I learn, whatever state I may be in, therein to be content.
author: Helen Keller

text: Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. The fearful are caught as often as the bold.
author: Helen Keller

text: Believe, when you are most unhappy, that there is something for you to do in the world. So long as you can sweeten another's pain, life is not in vain.
author: Helen Keller

text: Alone we can do so little. Together we can do so much.
author: Helen Keller

text: Until the great mass of the people shall be filled with the sense of responsibility for each other's welfare, social justice can never be attained.
author: Helen Keller

text: Self-pity is our worst enemy and if we yield to it, we can never do anything wise in this world.
author: Helen Keller

text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing. To keep our faces toward change and behave likefree spirits in the presence of fate is strength undefeatable.
author: Helen Keller

text: When we do the best that we can, we never know what miracle is wrought in our life, or in the life of another.
author: Helen Keller

text: So long as the memory of certain beloved friends lives in my heart, I shall say that life is good.
author: Helen Keller

text: What we have once enjoyed we can never lose; All that we love deeply, becomes a part of us.
author: Helen Keller

text: Keep your face to the sunshine and you can never see the shadow
author: Helen Keller

text: The best things in life are unseen, thats why we close our eyes when we kiss, cry, and dream.
author: Helen Keller

text: Defeat is simply a signal to press onward.
author: Helen Keller

text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched -- they must be felt with the heart.
author: Helen Keller

text: Keep your face to the sunshine and you can never see the shadow.
author: Helen Keller

text: You will succeed if you persevere; and you will find joy in overcoming obstacles.
author: Helen Keller

text: Do not think of todays failures, but of the success that may come tomorrow.
author: Helen Keller

text: When one door of happiness closes, another opens, but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one that has been opened for us.
author: Helen Keller

text: We can do anything we want to do if we stick to it long enough.
author: Helen Keller

text: Although the world is full of suffering it is also full of overcoming it.
author: Helen Keller

text: True happiness is not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
author: Helen Keller

text: Never bend your head. Hold it high. Look the world straight in the eye.
author: Helen Keller

text: Be of good cheer. Do not think of today's failures, but of the success that may come tomorrow. You have set yourselves a difficult task, but you will succeed if you persevere; and you will find joy in overcoming obstacles.
author: Helen Keller

text: Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much
author: Helen Keller

text: What we have once enjoyed we can never lose...All that we love deeply becomes a part of us.
author: Helen Keller

text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
author: Helen Keller

text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing. To keep our faces toward change and behave like free spirits in the presence of fate is strength undefeatable.
author: Helen Keller

text: I seldom think about my limitations, and they never make me sad. Perhaps there is just a touch of yearning at times; but it is vague, like a breeze among flowers.
author: Helen Keller

text: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadow. It's what sunflowers do.
author: Helen Keller

text: I thank God for my handicaps for, through them, I have found myself, my work, and my God.
author: Helen Keller

text: The unselfish effort to bring cheer to others will be the beginning of a happier life for ourselves.
author: Helen Keller

text: The idea of brotherhood re-dawns upon the world with a broader significance than the narrow association of members in a sect or creed.
author: Helen Keller

text: A bend in the road is not the end of the roadâ€¦Unless you fail to make the turn.
author: Helen Keller

text: No pessimist ever discovered the secret of the stars, or sailed to an uncharted land, or opened a new doorway for the human spirit.
author: Helen Keller

text: As the eagle was killed by the arrow winged with his own feather, so the hand of the world is wounded by its own skill.
author: Helen Keller

text: Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of men as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure, or nothing.
author: Helen Keller

text: If the blind put their hands in God's, they find their way more surely than those who see but have not faith or purpose.
author: Helen Keller

text: The only thing worse than being blind is having sight but no vision.
author: Helen Keller

text: Better to be blind and see with your heart, than to have two good eyes and see nothing.
author: Helen Keller

text: The most pathetic person in the world is someone who has sight, but has no vision.
author: Helen Keller

text: Never bend your head. Always hold it high. Look the world straight in the face.
author: Helen Keller

text: Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, vision cleared, ambition inspired, and success achieved.
author: Helen Keller

text: If it is true that the violin is the most perfect of musical instruments, then Greek is the violin of human thought.
author: Helen Keller

text: Tyranny cannot defeat the power of ideas.
author: Helen Keller

text: Never bend your head. Always hold it high. Look the world straight in the eye.
author: Helen Keller

text: Joy is the holy fire that keeps our purpose warm and our intelligence aglow.
author: Helen Keller

text: No one has a right to consume happiness without producing it.
author: Helen Keller

text: No pessimist ever discovered the secrets of the stars, or sailed to an uncharted land, or opened a new heaven to the human spirit.
author: Helen Keller

text: Let pessimism once take hold of the mind, and life is all topsy-turvy, all vanity and vexation of spirit. There is no cure for individual or social disorder, except in forgetfulness and annihilation.
author: Helen Keller

text: The best preparedness is the one that disarms the hostility of other nations and makes friends of them.
author: Helen Keller

text: Instead of comparing our lot with that of those who are more fortunate than we are, we should compare it with the lot of the great majority of our fellow men. It then appears that we are among the privileged.
author: Helen Keller

text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched they must be felt with the heart.
author: Helen Keller

text: When all you can feel are the shadows, turn your face towards the sun.
author: Helen Keller

text: It is hard to interest those who have everything in those who have nothing.
author: Helen Keller

text: The world is full of suffering. It is also full of overcoming.
author: Helen Keller

text: Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.
author: Helen Keller

text: Doubts and mistrust are the mere panic of timid imagination, which the steadfast heart will conquer, and the large mind transcend.
author: Helen Keller

text: Only in quietness do we possess our own minds and discover the resources of the Inner Life.
author: Helen Keller

text: No pessimist ever discovered the secret of the stars, or sailed an uncharted land or opened a new doorway for the human spirit.
author: Helen Keller

text: My share of the work may be limited, but the fact that it is work makes it precious.
author: Helen Keller

text: Face your deficiencies and acknowledge them; but do not let them master you. Let them teach you patience, sweetness, insight.
author: Helen Keller

text: There is no better way to thank God for your sight than by giving a helping hand to someone in the dark.
author: Helen Keller

text: It is a terrible thing to see and have no vision.
author: Helen Keller

text: Smells are the fallen angels of the senses.
author: Helen Keller

text: Smell is a potent wizard that transports you across thousands of miles and all the years you have lived.
author: Helen Keller

text: Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature.
author: Helen Keller

text: Look the world straight in the eye.
author: Helen Keller

text: World peace will never come until the passion of supremacy is combated.
author: Helen Keller

text: The few own the many because they possess the means of livelihood of all ... The country is governed for the richest, for the corporations, the bankers, the land speculators, and for the exploiters of labor. The majority of mankind are working people. So long as their fair demands - the ownership and control of their livelihoods - are set at naught, we can have neither men's rights nor women's rights. The majority of mankind is ground down by industrial oppression in order that the small remnant may live in ease.
author: Helen Keller

text: Strike against war, for without you no battles can be fought!
author: Helen Keller

text: Many people know so little about what is beyond their short range of experience. They look within themselves - and find nothing! Therefore they conclude that there is nothing outside themselves either.
author: Helen Keller

text: I feel the delightful, velvety texture of a flower, and discover its remarkable convolutions; and something of the miracle of Nature is revealed to me.
author: Helen Keller

text: What we have once enjoyed deeply we can never lose. For all that we love deeply becomes a part of us.
author: Helen Keller

text: Believe, when you are most unhappy, that there is something for you to do in the world. So long as you can sweeten another’s pain, life is not in vain.
author: Helen Keller

text: Love is like a beautiful flower which I may not touch, but whose fragrance makes the garden a place of delight just the same.
author: Helen Keller

text: The best Christmas gift of all is the presence of a happy family all wrapped up with one another.
author: Helen Keller

text: No pessimist ever discovered the secrets of the stars or sailed to an uncharted land or opened a new heaven to the human spirit.
author: Helen Keller

text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched, they must be felt with the heart.
author: Helen Keller

text: When we do the best we can, we never know what miracle is wrought in our life, or in the life of another.
author: Helen Keller
